skill.name: building-mcp-servers
skill.description:
Guides creation of high-quality MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers that enable LLMs
to interact with external services through well-designed tools. Use when building MCP
servers to integrate external APIs or services, whether in Python (FastMCP) or
Node/TypeScript (MCP SDK). Covers tool design, authentication, Docker deployment,
and evaluation creation. NOT when consuming existing MCP servers (use the server directly).

content.user_title: Build MCP Servers for LLM Integration
content.value_statement: Creating high-quality MCP servers enables LLMs to interact with external services through well-designed tools. This skill provides comprehensive guidance on MCP server development, testing, and deployment for both Python and TypeScript.
actual_capabilities: Create MCP servers in Python using FastMCP framework
Create MCP servers in TypeScript using MCP SDK
Design tools with proper naming, annotations, and input validation
Implement authentication patterns (OAuth, API keys, JWT)
Build evaluation harnesses to test MCP server effectiveness
Deploy MCP servers with Docker and configure transport security
limitations: This is a guidance skill - it does not create MCP servers directly
Does not provide pre-built MCP servers for specific services
Requires users to implement their own server code
Does not host or run MCP servers

use_cases.title: Build Custom Integrations

use_cases.title: Enable Third-Party Access

use_cases.title: Test Server Quality

prompt_templates.title: New Python Server
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an MCP server in Python using FastMCP for the {service_name} API. Include tools for {tool_examples}. Use Pydantic for input validation with proper error handling.

prompt_templates.title: New TypeScript Server
prompt_templates.prompt: Build an MCP server in TypeScript using the MCP SDK for {service_name}. Create tools with Zod validation for {tool_examples}. Configure streamable HTTP transport.

prompt_templates.title: Add Tool
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a new tool called {tool_name} to the existing {language} MCP server. The tool should {description}. Include annotations and {validation_type} validation.

prompt_templates.title: Create Evaluation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an evaluation file for my MCP server. Write 10 questions that test whether LLMs can use the tools correctly to answer realistic, complex questions.

output_examples.input: Help me create an MCP server for the GitHub API in Python
output: Here is a comprehensive guide to building an MCP server for GitHub API using Python and FastMCP:
1. Set up project structure with FastMCP and httpx for API calls
2. Create Pydantic models for input validation
3. Implement tools with proper naming (github_list_repos, github_create_issue)
6. Test with MCP Inspector before deployment
7. Create evaluation questions to measure LLM effectiveness
See references/python_mcp_server.md for complete implementation examples.

best_practices: Use consistent tool naming with service prefix (github_create_issue, not create_issue)
Implement proper input validation with Pydantic or Zod schemas
Return both human-readable Markdown and machine-readable JSON formats
Include pagination and limit results to prevent context overflow
anti_patterns: Avoid generic tool names that conflict with other MCP servers
Do not skip input validation - always use Pydantic or Zod
Do not return unstructured text when structured data would be more useful
Avoid hardcoding API keys - use environment variables instead

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: Python (FastMCP) and TypeScript (MCP SDK). Both provide similar capabilities with language-specific syntax.

faq.question: What transport mechanisms are available?
faq.answer: Streamable HTTP for remote servers, stdio for local integrations. SSE is deprecated in favor of streamable HTTP.

faq.question: How do I authenticate MCP servers?
faq.answer: Use OAuth 2.1 for external services, API keys in environment variables, or JWT token forwarding for internal services.

faq.question: Is data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a documentation skill. The evaluation script only makes API calls to Anthropic and configurable MCP servers you specify.

faq.question: Why is my evaluation failing?
faq.answer: Check tool descriptions are clear, input schemas are correct, and error messages guide the LLM toward solutions. Review agent feedback in reports.

faq.question: How is this different from using Claude Tools?
faq.answer: MCP servers extend Claude's capabilities by integrating with external services. This skill helps you build those bridges.
